intro: Pycnostachys rotundatodentata, commonly known as the round-toothed pycnostachy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, rounded teeth on the leaf margins. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are clustered in dense inflorescences. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in humid, lowland areas.
